intro: Spergularia borchersii, commonly known as the Borchers' sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal or inland dunes. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered with fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Spergularia borchersii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy habitats through its extensive root system.
